title: Synthetic Recap
body:
NEW YORK – In the heart of Texas, David Robinson’s Herculean effort was not enough to overcome the defensive wall of the New York Knicks, as the Spurs fell 94-77 in a contest defined by one man’s historic, yet solitary, battle.

The Admiral commanded the floor, delivering a performance for the ages with a staggering 47 points, 11 rebounds, and 3 blocked shots. From the opening tip, Robinson was unstoppable, attacking the rim and converting with a relentless efficiency that left the Knicks scrambling for an answer. Every San Antonio possession seemed to funnel through their center, a testament to his sheer dominance on the offensive end.

However, basketball remains a team game, and the Knicks embodied that principle. While no individual scorer could match Robinson’s output, New York’s attack was a balanced and ruthless machine. Patrick Ewing provided a formidable 22-point, 10-rebound double-double, while Allan Houston chipped in 20 points. More critically, the Knicks’ defense clamped down on every other Spur, rendering Robinson’s supporting cast ineffective.

The final score tells the tale: a 17-point victory built not on outscoring a legend, but on suffocating his teammates. Robinson’s magnificent 47 points will be remembered as one of the great individual performances of the era, a shining beacon of individual excellence. But on this night, it was the Knicks’ collective strength that sailed away with the victory, leaving a historic stat line as a mere footnote in their win column.
